document.heading: Repeat Offender Life Without Parole Amendment Act of 1994

history.narrative: Law 10-194, the “Repeat Offender Life Without Parole Amendment Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-478, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 7, 1994, and June 21, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 21, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-254 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-194 became effective on October 7, 1994.
